alarms.alarmMeaning: The power switch is ON, AC power is not available, and the ventilator is being powered by the backup power source (BPS).
alarms.recommendedAction: Prepare for power loss. Obtain alternate ventilation. Check integrity of AC power source. Contact service if necessary.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The set apnea interval has elapsed without the ventilator, patient or operator triggering a breath.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings.

alarms.alarmMeaning: There is a disconnection in the patient circuit before the patient wye or patient disconnect is detected following power restoration from an unintentional power loss with the power switch ON.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Reconnect patient circuit. Press ALARM RESET.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Compressor cannot maintain sufficient supply pressure.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Obtain alternate ventilation. Remove ventilator from use and contact service.

alarms.alarmMeaning: A background test or power on self-test (POST) has detected a problem.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. If prompted to do so, obtain alternate ventilation or contact service.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Background checks have detected a problem with the O₂ sensor.
alarms.recommendedAction: O₂ sensor is out of calibration or has failed. Press 100% O₂ CAL; replace or disable the sensor.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The measured airway pressure is equal to or greater than the set limit. Reduced tidal volume likely.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient, patient circuit and endotracheal tube.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The O₂% measured during any phase of a breath cycle is 7% (12% during the first hour of operation) or more above the O₂% setting for at least 30 seconds. (These percentages increase by 5% for four minutes following a decrease in the O₂% setting.)
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient, air and oxygen supplies, oxygen analyzer and ventilator.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The patient's exhaled tidal volume for any breath is equal to or greater than the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings. Consider whether the patient’s compliance or resistance has changed.

alarms.alarmMessage: VE TOT (High exhaled total minute volume)
alarms.alarmMeaning: The patient's expiratory minute volume is equal to or greater than the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The delivered volume of any tube compensated (TC) breath is equal to or greater than the inspired tidal volume limit. Ventilator transitions to exhalation.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Check for leaks, tube type/I.D. setting.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The breath rate from all breaths is greater than or equal to the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The inspiratory pressure transducer has measured a pressure of at least 100 cm H₂O. Active only during volume-controlled breaths. Ventilator transitions to exhalation. Reduced tidal volume likely.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Obtain alternate ventilation. Remove ventilator from use and contact service.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The target pressure of a tube compensated (TC) breath equals the PCIRC limit. This limit is equal to the setting of P PEAK. Inspiration pressure is limited during this alarm.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Check for leaks, tube type/I.D. setting.

alarms.alarmMeaning: BPS is installed but not functioning.
alarms.recommendedAction: Contact service.

alarms.alarmMeaning: IBW-based inspiratory time for a spontaneous breath exceeds ventilator-set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Check for leaks.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The ventilator power switch is on and there is insufficient power from the AC supply and the BPS. There may not be a visual indicator for this alarm, but an independent audio alarm sounds for at least 120 seconds.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check integrity of AC power and BPS connections. Obtain alternate ventilation.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Mains AC power has dropped below 80% of nominal voltage for at least one second. Warns that AC power has dropped significantly, and that a more severe power drop may be imminent. The ventilator turns off the compressor (if installed), and otherwise operates normally.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check integrity of connection to AC power. Check AC power supply.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The BPS has less than approximately two minutes of operational time remaining.
alarms.recommendedAction: Replace BPS or allow it to recharge during normal ventilator operation.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The O₂% measured during any phase of a breath cycle is 7% (12% during the first hour of operation) or more below the O₂% setting for at least 30 seconds, or below 18%. (These percentages increase by 5% for four minutes following an increase in the O₂% setting.)
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient, air and oxygen supplies, oxygen analyzer and ventilator. Calibrate oxygen sensor (press 100% O₂/CAL 2 min key).

alarms.alarmMeaning: The patient's exhaled mandatory tidal volume is less than or equal to the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Check for leaks or changes in the patient’s resistance or compliance.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The patient's exhaled spontaneous tidal volume is less than or equal to the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings.

alarms.alarmMeaning: The minute volume for all breaths is less than or equal to the set limit.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and settings.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Air supply pressure is less than the minimum required pressure for correct ventilator operation throughout its range of flows. Accurate O₂% delivery may be compromised. You cannot set or disable the NO AIR SUPPLY alarm.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and air source. Obtain alternate ventilation.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Oxygen supply pressure is less than the minimum required pressure for correct ventilator operation throughout its range of flows. Accurate O₂% delivery may be compromised. You cannot set or disable the NO O₂ SUPPLY alarm.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient and oxygen source. Obtain alternate ventilation.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Patient attached before ventilator startup is complete. Safety ventilation is active.
alarms.recommendedAction: Provide alternate ventilation. Complete ventilator startup procedure.

alarms.alarmMeaning: Patient circuit is severely occluded.
alarms.recommendedAction: Check patient. Obtain alternate ventilation if necessary. Check patient circuit for crimps, blocked filter. If problem persists, remove ventilator from use and contact service.
